title: iMac Pro - No image on internal display - External image present - customer been inside
message:
Hello friends,

Client has attempted CPU replacement on this, after replacement client said internal display stopped working but external still worked. Client bought new display and mounted it, internal still doesnt work.

Component im pointing to in image has been ripped off and 2 pins in cpu socket were bent. The pins have been bent back.

Wondering if the component in question is vital or the cause would be something else, im suspecting the display issue is not because of this.

[ATTACH type="full"]61085[/ATTACH]

title: iMac Pro - No image on internal display - External image present - customer been inside
message:
What is your 820-xxxxx MLB code?

Check if video connector is not damaged.
Also inspect for knocked off components near it.

title: iMac Pro - No image on internal display - External image present - customer been inside
message:
Board is 820-00967

Video connector looks good, [S]no knocked components nearby[/S]. One knocked what i presume is a resistor near the connector
[ATTACH type="full"]61087[/ATTACH]

I noticed another knocked component near the first one, see the arrow.
[ATTACH type="full"]61086[/ATTACH]

title: iMac Pro - No image on internal display - External image present - customer been inside
message:
I might have found the resistor in question
[ATTACH type="full"]61088[/ATTACH]
[ATTACH type="full"]61089[/ATTACH]

title: iMac Pro - No image on internal display - External image present - customer been inside
message: Check in schematic what you need to resolder there.

title: iMac Pro - No image on internal display - External image present - customer been inside
message:
The resistor solved it, thanks for the help!
[ATTACH type="full"]61090[/ATTACH]
